title: The Easiest Way to Deploy a React App on Hostinger (My Real Experience)
excerpt: A step-by-step guide to deploying your Vite + React application on Hostinger. No complex setup, just build, upload, and go live in minutes.
content:
If you’ve built a React app using Vite and want to get it online fast, Hostinger makes the whole process surprisingly simple. I recently deployed my portfolio website—and yes, the blog you’re currently reading—using these exact steps.

Everything went live in less than an hour, even though the DNS migration took longer globally. Here’s exactly how I did it.

01. What You Need

  • A Hostinger hosting plan
  • A working React + Vite project
  • A custom domain (either from Hostinger or mapped externally)
  • A few minutes of time

02. Build Your Vite App

Inside your project, run the build command to create your production files:

npm run build

This creates the dist/ folder with all production files.

03. Uploading Files to Hostinger

I actually tested two deployment methods:

Method 1 – Upload ZIP (works but not the simplest)

I initially zipped my dist/ folder and uploaded it to Hostinger. It works, but it isn’t the fastest method.

Method 2 – Direct Upload (the easiest & the method used for this blog)

This is the method I used when deploying both my personal portfolio and the blog you’re reading right now:

  1. Open hPanel → File Manager
  2. Navigate to public_html
  3. Upload all files and folders directly from the dist/ folder
  4. Delete any default Hostinger files (like index.php)

No extraction. No complications. Just drag → upload → done.

04. Fixing Routing (Important)

If you are using React Router (like I am), you might face issues where refreshing a page gives a 404 error. To fix this, you need to create an .htaccess file in your public_html folder.

Add the following code to it:

.htaccess 
RewriteEngine On
RewriteBase /

# Serve existing files normally
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} -f [OR]
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} -d
RewriteRule ^ - [L]

# Redirect everything else to index.html (SPA routing)
RewriteRule . /index.html [L]

This ensures that all requests are handled by your React app, preventing 404 errors on page refresh.

05. Custom Domain Mapping

This part surprised me a bit:

  • Hostinger mentions domain propagation can take up to 24 hours
  • My site was accessible in under 1 hour
  • Full global propagation completed after ~24 hours

So even though DNS takes time to update everywhere, you can still access your website quickly.

06. Install Free SSL

Inside hPanel:

  1. Go to Security → SSL → Install
  2. Hostinger automatically issues a free Let's Encrypt SSL certificate
  3. Your site becomes HTTPS instantly without additional setup

07. No Backend or Database Needed

Since this was only a React + Vite frontend project, I didn’t configure:

  • any database
  • any backend API
  • any server-side code

Just simple static hosting — perfect for a portfolio, personal blog, or landing page.

08. Result: My Portfolio + This Blog Is Live

Within an hour:

  • My React app was live
  • My custom domain was connected
  • SSL was activated
  • Everything worked perfectly

This exact blog post you're reading right now was deployed using these same steps.

"With Vite, the deployment becomes: build → upload → connect domain → done."

If you want the simplest way to publish a portfolio or static React site, Hostinger is ideal. No complex setup. No backend required. Just clean and fast hosting.
